basics.name: Jordan Wong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science - Data Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

work.summary: Branch lead of UH Groupings project
highlights: Worked on the development of a web application used by faculty to organize groupings of students and other faculty members built using Angular.js, Java, Spring Boot, and Agile methodology Kanban
Implemented and improved UI/UX features with a strong focus on user experience using Bootstrap and SCSS
Refactored over 2000 lines of UI and RESTful API functions to improve overall efficiency and code readability
Significantly increased unit/integration test coverage of UI using Jasmine tests and API using JUnit tests
Developed and wrote documentation for a side-project to aid current and new team members in transition into a more modern tech stack built in React.js, Next.js, TypeScript, and Jest testing framework
Branch-Lead role: Conduct code reviews, communicate with teammates and merge pull requests in a timely manner to ensure the project upkeeps code quality and meets production deployment deadlines
Mentor role: Train, guide, help and give tips to new team members

volunteer.summary: Referee for VEX IQ robotics competitions
highlights: Inspect robots to ensure they follow all rules and requirements before and during the competition
Count and keep track of scores for all matches during the competition

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Earned a semester GPA of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more. Did not receive grades of NC (no credit), W (withdrawn), I (incomplete), F (failure)
